text: Hi. I wish to know, is it possible to add a sign-out / log-out link in the navigation of private content, so that when the user clicks on it he is logged out from the account and arrives at the login-page.

<@UH36ZQSD9> yes this is possible, within your settings > website > private content you can say what page to go to when someone signs out
to actually log someone out you direct them to
/_hcms/mem/logout

• Thanks <@U0177RKAS1H>. So, if someones clicks on a link that has the address ‘`<page_ domain>/_hcms/mem/logout` , they actually gets logged out of the session?
’

no problem and to show different nav dependant on whether you are logged in you can just do the following in your hubl
`{% if request_contact.is_logged_in %}`

Hello. I wish to know if it possible to actually check the login page email field for existing users ? For eg: If a user logins with an email that is not registered as a member for the private content, an error message should be shown instantly that he/she is not a member and needs to register.

<@UH36ZQSD9> as far as i know this is not possible, but this behaviour is considered bad practice as it gives hackers an indication as to whether an email address exists, they can then bombard a site with a db of email addresses until they get a hit.
